Everyone who played or saw this game know the truth. It is a rip off of Zelda Breath of The Wild. Same color scheme, same gameplay, similar music. People often even confuse it with Zelda BOTW. 

I don’t know how or why this is allowed to be sold.

title.label: I want to love it but too many bugs

title.label: Solid and Fun - a few minor issues

content.label:
First of all, this is a well crafted game overall. Let’s be clear, the annoyances I mention below in no way detract from the fact that this game is a lot of fun. I played through the whole thing in a couple weeks. I have not completed *all* the extras, but have done many of them.

The story is fun. The graphics are beautiful. The writers depart from expected outcomes in several major ways and I was surprised by that at times. Not bad at all. 

The items you get are fun to work with and while being familiar (aka: if you ever played Legend of Zelda), have a uniqueness of their own. 

A few annoying things: you get all this treasure/coins while playing the game and finding treasure chests, great. The issue is, there is little/nothing that is interesting to do with said money. You can basically only buy ammo and hearts and the occasional upgrade shard. I found that very boring. This being given, there were many times I went through extra time and trouble to access and open a treasure chest, expecting something great, only to be disappointed by ...more coins. I wish that there were more cool items or weapons or whatever as rewards over a bunch of relatively useless coins. Even having different armor or outfits for the hero would have been nice.

Controls-wise, I found it a constant nuisance when trying to break/strike a pot, my character regularly picked it up instead. Seemed like it would have been better to make that action a separate button. Also, I noticed many times having trouble, particularly while flying or in the boat, turning the screen view. Seemed like a glitch.

Again, overall, great game. Thanks for making it!

title.label: Love the story and everything else

content.label: I beat oceanhorn and at that time I had the shield of chronos and the astroblade but the astroblade’s story was great being able to stop oceanhorn for a bit was such a big help for a bit and being inspired by one of my favorite game’s now legend of Zelda breath of the wild was one of my favorite bit’s and the responing pot’s when you’re battling mesmeroth it’s the only reason I beat mesmeroth. Thank you for making this game

title.label: Good game, but has some hiccups

content.label: I really enjoy this game. It’s creative, difficult but not impossible, and really fun. I have been playing it non stop for a week now and am just barley halfway through the first big challenge. I would give it five stars, but the game can be laggy (sometimes during really important boss battles when lag is the last thing you need) and the graphics could be a little better. But on whole i definitely recommend this game to anyone who likes action and adventure games.

title.label: A great GAME for any Zelda fan!

content.label: I must say that this game is superb!!! It will most definitely appeal to fans of The Legend of Zelda franchise( Ocarina of Time in particular!). Zelda fans will see what I’m referencing after a few hours of play but Oceanhorn 2 is its own game in its own right. Kudos to the developers and Apple Arcade for releasing such a beautiful game with outstanding graphics, dialogue, and story! Please please please continue to release  more games like Oceanhorn 2. This is definitely better than I expected!

It copies the LoZ game windwaker except for the windwaker itself. Rolling, swords, boomerangs... except you basically can’t jump at all. Enemies are overpowered, too.

This game is actually really good, the graphics are surprisingly good for mobile and the mechanics play smooth. My only complaint is it drains my battery but that is probably because my phone is a couple years old and gets drained from about anything. I would recommend this game and honestly it’s worth getting Apple Arcade just for this.

title.label: Pretty game, but super repetitive and boring

content.label:
The first one was not bad, but it seems like the entire dev team spent their time on the visuals. 

The sword gameplay is super boring. It is just incredibly repetitive. I can’t believe how boring the first 3 levels are! You’re just clicking until you die then click some more. Even the shield barely adds any complexity.
I love this game but I can’t beat The fire bird 😭😭

The game is graphically beautiful.  Not sure if I’ve seen a game that looks any better in iOS.  The music is also very impressive.  The gameplay isn’t bad, but it’s a bit too basic.  I think the most disappointing part of the gameplay is finding the hidden sparkles across the map, only to find out it’s just a coin.  The currency in the game doesn’t seem to have much of a purpose.  It would be great to use it to purchase upgrades.  Instead, it’s used to buy health and ammunition, which is found regularly by just slashing bushes and enemies.   The currency really needs to be tied to something a bit more satisfying.

I truly love this game. And waiting impatiently for Oceanhorn 3. ❤️

I love to see devs working to bridge the gap between console and mobile gaming experiences, but for all the effort poured into Oceanhorn 2, one simply can’t ignore how poorly 3D action experiences translate to small touch screens. This isn’t a fault of Oceanhorn 2, nor the dev team. I simply cannot recommend playing this game without at least a controller, and ideally a larger screen. In the interest of full disclosure, I admit to only trying this game via Apple Arcade before committing to a purchase on the Nintendo Switch, which seems a much more ideal platform. 

Aside from being a console game shoved into mobile devices, Oceanhorn 2 pays just Ike any other Zelda clone. I felt right at home with the familiar adventure, combat, puzzle solving, and dungeon diving mechanics, which was refreshing being one of three people who doesn’t like BOTW.

TLDR; if you’ve ever wanted to play classic 3D Zelda on your mobile device, then definitely buy this for Switch.

For fans of role-playing games, Oceanhorn 2 is reason enough to join Apple Arcade. 

It’s a classic RPG, with all the traditional elements. Dungeons to explore, quests to complete, monsters to slay. 

Graphics and the overall design are beautiful. And Oceanhorn 2 plays even better with a physical controller. I used the PlayStation 4 DualShock 4 controller.

title.label: The only five star review I have ever given to a mobile game

content.label: Oceanhorn 2 Raised the bar for mobile games. There should be no more excuses for devs to make sub par games because its "mobile". I hope devs follow in their foot steps and start releasing real games for mobile instead of subpar uninvested cash grabs.

What’s up with the ending?! I write short stories all the time, adventure, action,  sadness, and I have never EVER liked a happy ending. But you left it in such a bad spot that you have to keep going! I was so disappointed when Trin and the “boy” ran away at the end and then that was the end! I love this game but it made me so made that the city, world, was left in runes and the heroes just run away. Please tell me there is another game. Oceanhorn 3 perhaps? To be honest it made me mad. Such a good story can’t just end with that. Originally before the ending I would have given this a 100 star, but…. Tell me there is an Oceanhorn 3 please. Thank you.

Please make a sequel to this it was so fun to play I loved playing the game and was sad when it ended also would be nice to know what happened to the hero and Trin but like I said this is an amazing game

Thanks for reading my review😊

AGAIN. a visually stunning game with controls so bad you can’t even play it. Your avi just randomly jumps off of things when all you wanted to do was walk forward. Garbage. How is this trash getting good reviews? People playing with controllers? ITS A PHONE GAME, IF YOU CANT PLAY IT ON THE PHONE IT IS A FAILURE. Apple Arcade is something I really believed in but right now it’s batting 0/10.

This old gamer was was shocked.... between the immersive story and ability to roam and play as you like this may be my favorite game since Dark Souls, Baldur’s Gate and maybe as far back Bard’s Tale.  It’s good to see game developers can still do it right.   Thanks and looking forward to more greats from them and hopefully Apple Arcade.
